main.name: William Park
main.description: I'm currently in the computer engineering program at the University of Waterloo, entering my 2B term in Fall 2021
main.bio: I'm passionate about programming, particularly in web development (full-stack), machine learning, and blockchain. I also love music - I've been playing the guitar for eight years (fingerstyle, jazz, rock) and I worked as an instructor for three years.
main.contactmessage: Feel free to reach out to me if you have any inquiries.

resume.skillmessage: Here are some skills that I've picked up through work, school and personal projects.

education.description: Scholarships: Presidentâ€™s Scholarship of Distinction -  Awarded to students with an admission average of 95% or higher; Nortel Networks Undergraduate Scholarship - Awarded to outstanding students entering year one of electrical and computer engineering.

work.title: Software Developer in Test
work.description: Executed automation tests using Selenium WebDriver with Java and TestNG to verify site functionality for YuJa, a media solutions platform designed for use by educational institutions and enterprises. Performed analysis and reporting on more than 500 Jira tickets regarding ongoing web, desktop, and mobile application systems. Recommended design and functionality aspects for web and mobile application features during daily SCRUM meetings based on client needs, primarily for the YuJa video-conferencing application.

testimonials.text: Here you should write some nice things that someone has said about you. No lies though, employers can tell when you are lying.

That Tim Baker must be one of the most brilliant developers I've ever met! It is amazing that nobody has hired him yet. Hey you, you should hire this guy, he may be fresh out of University and have zero on the job experience but I am confident that he will be one of your best developers in no time!
